net.consensys.cava.bytes

Interface Bytes

  • All Known Subinterfaces:
    Bytes32, MutableBytes, MutableBytes32
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    AbstractBytes, MutableByteBufferWrappingBytes

    public interface Bytes
    A value made of bytes.

    This interface makes no thread-safety guarantee, and a Bytes value is generally not thread safe. However, specific implementations may be thread-safe. For instance, the value returned by copy() is guaranteed to be thread-safe as it is immutable.

    • Field Summary

      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      static Bytes EMPTY
      The empty value (with 0 bytes).

    • Field Detail

      • EMPTY

        static final Bytes EMPTY
        The empty value (with 0 bytes).

    • Method Detail

      • wrap

        static Bytes wrap(byte[] value)
        Wrap the provided byte array as a Bytes value.

        Note that value is not copied and thus any future update to value will be reflected in the returned value.

        Parameters:
        value - The value to wrap.
        Returns:
        A Bytes value wrapping value.

      • wrap

        static Bytes wrap(byte[] value,
                  int offset,
                  int length)
        Wrap a slice of a byte array as a Bytes value.

        Note that value is not copied and thus any future update to value within the slice will be reflected in the returned value.

        Parameters:
        value - The value to wrap.
        offset - The index (inclusive) in value of the first byte exposed by the returned value. In other words, you will have wrap(value, o, l).get(0) == value[o].
        length - The length of the resulting value.
        Returns:
        A Bytes value that expose the bytes of value from offset (inclusive) to offset + length (exclusive).
        Throws:
        java.lang.IndexOutOfBoundsException - if offset &lt; 0 || (value.length > 0 && offset >= value.length).
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if length &lt; 0 || offset + length > value.length.

      • wrap

        static Bytes wrap(Bytes... values)
        Wrap a list of other values into a concatenated view.

        Note that the values are not copied and thus any future update to the values will be reflected in the returned value. If copying the inputs is desired, use concatenate(Bytes...).

        Parameters:
        values - The values to wrap.
        Returns:
        A value representing a view over the concatenation of all values.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the result overflows an int.

      • concatenate

        static Bytes concatenate(Bytes... values)
        Create a value containing the concatenation of the values provided.
        Parameters:
        values - The values to copy and concatenate.
        Returns:
        A value containing the result of concatenating the value from values in their provided order.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the result overflows an int.

      • wrapBuffer

        static Bytes wrapBuffer(io.vertx.core.buffer.Buffer buffer)
        Wrap a full Vert.x Buffer as a Bytes value.

        Note that any change to the content of the buffer may be reflected in the returned value.

        Parameters:
        buffer - The buffer to wrap.
        Returns:
        A Bytes value.

      • wrapBuffer

        static Bytes wrapBuffer(io.vertx.core.buffer.Buffer buffer,
                        int offset,
                        int size)
        Wrap a slice of a Vert.x Buffer as a Bytes value.

        Note that any change to the content of the buffer may be reflected in the returned value.

        Parameters:
        buffer - The buffer to wrap.
        offset - The offset in buffer from which to expose the bytes in the returned value. That is, wrapBuffer(buffer, i, 1).get(0) == buffer.getByte(i).
        size - The size of the returned value.
        Returns:
        A Bytes value.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IndexOutOfBoundsException - if offset &lt; 0 || (buffer.length() > 0 && offset >= buffer.length()).
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if length &lt; 0 || offset + length > buffer.length().

      • wrapByteBuf

        static Bytes wrapByteBuf(io.netty.buffer.ByteBuf byteBuf)
        Wrap a full Netty ByteBuf as a Bytes value.

        Note that any change to the content of the byteBuf may be reflected in the returned value.

        Parameters:
        byteBuf - The ByteBuf to wrap.
        Returns:
        A Bytes value.

      • wrapByteBuf

        static Bytes wrapByteBuf(io.netty.buffer.ByteBuf byteBuf,
                         int offset,
                         int size)
        Wrap a slice of a Netty ByteBuf as a Bytes value.

        Note that any change to the content of the buffer may be reflected in the returned value.

        Parameters:
        byteBuf - The ByteBuf to wrap.
        offset - The offset in byteBuf from which to expose the bytes in the returned value. That is, wrapByteBuf(byteBuf, i, 1).get(0) == byteBuf.getByte(i).
        size - The size of the returned value.
        Returns:
        A Bytes value.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IndexOutOfBoundsException - if offset &lt; 0 || (byteBuf.capacity() > 0 && offset >= byteBuf.capacity()).
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if length &lt; 0 || offset + length > byteBuf.capacity().

      • wrapByteBuffer

        static Bytes wrapByteBuffer(java.nio.ByteBuffer byteBuffer,
                            int offset,
                            int size)
        Wrap a slice of a Java NIO ByteBuf as a Bytes value.

        Note that any change to the content of the buffer may be reflected in the returned value.

        Parameters:
        byteBuffer - The ByteBuffer to wrap.
        offset - The offset in byteBuffer from which to expose the bytes in the returned value. That is, wrapByteBuffer(byteBuffer, i, 1).get(0) == byteBuffer.getByte(i).
        size - The size of the returned value.
        Returns:
        A Bytes value.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IndexOutOfBoundsException - if offset &lt; 0 || (byteBuffer.limit() > 0 && offset >= byteBuf.limit()).
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if length &lt; 0 || offset + length > byteBuffer.limit().

      • ofUnsignedShort

        static Bytes ofUnsignedShort(int value)
        Return a 2 bytes value corresponding to the provided value interpreted as an unsigned short value.
        Parameters:
        value - The value, which must fit an unsigned short.
        Returns:
        A 2 bytes value corresponding to v.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if v < 0 or v is too big to fit an unsigned 2-bytes short (that is, if v >= (1 << 16)).

      • ofUnsignedInt

        static Bytes ofUnsignedInt(long value)
        Return a 4 bytes value corresponding to the provided value interpreted as an unsigned int value.
        Parameters:
        value - The value, which must fit an unsigned int.
        Returns:
        A 4 bytes value corresponding to v.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if v < 0 or v is too big to fit an unsigned 4-bytes int (that is, if v >= (1L << 32)).

      • minimalBytes

        static Bytes minimalBytes(long value)
        Return the smallest bytes value whose bytes correspond to the provided long. That is, the returned value may be of size less than 8 if the provided long has leading zero bytes.
        Parameters:
        value - The long from which to create the bytes value.
        Returns:
        The minimal bytes representation corresponding to l.

      • fromHexStringLenient

        static Bytes fromHexStringLenient(java.lang.CharSequence str)
        Parse a hexadecimal string into a Bytes value.

        This method is lenient in that str may of an odd length, in which case it will behave exactly as if it had an additional 0 in front.

        Parameters:
        str - The hexadecimal string to parse, which may or may not start with "0x".
        Returns:
        The value corresponding to str.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if str does not correspond to valid hexadecimal representation.

      • fromHexStringLenient

        static Bytes fromHexStringLenient(java.lang.CharSequence str,
                                  int destinationSize)
        Parse a hexadecimal string into a Bytes value of the provided size.

        This method allows for str to have an odd length, in which case it will behave exactly as if it had an additional 0 in front.

        Parameters:
        str - The hexadecimal string to parse, which may or may not start with "0x".
        destinationSize - The size of the returned value, which must be big enough to hold the bytes represented by str. If it is strictly bigger those bytes from str, the returned value will be left padded with zeros.
        Returns:
        A value of size destinationSize corresponding to str potentially left-padded.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if str does not correspond to valid hexadecimal representation, represents more bytes than destinationSize or destinationSize &lt; 0.

      • fromHexString

        static Bytes fromHexString(java.lang.CharSequence str)
        Parse a hexadecimal string into a Bytes value.

        This method requires that str have an even length.

        Parameters:
        str - The hexadecimal string to parse, which may or may not start with "0x".
        Returns:
        The value corresponding to str.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if str does not correspond to valid hexadecimal representation, or is of an odd length.

      • fromHexString

        static Bytes fromHexString(java.lang.CharSequence str,
                           int destinationSize)
        Parse a hexadecimal string into a Bytes value.

        This method requires that str have an even length.

        Parameters:
        str - The hexadecimal string to parse, which may or may not start with "0x".
        destinationSize - The size of the returned value, which must be big enough to hold the bytes represented by str. If it is strictly bigger those bytes from str, the returned value will be left padded with zeros.
        Returns:
        A value of size destinationSize corresponding to str potentially left-padded.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if str does correspond to valid hexadecimal representation, or is of an odd length.
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if str does not correspond to valid hexadecimal representation, or is of an odd length, or represents more bytes than destinationSize or destinationSize &lt; 0.

        int size()
        Returns:
        The number of bytes this value represents.

      • get

        byte get(int i)
        Retrieve a byte in this value.
        Parameters:
        i - The index of the byte to fetch within the value (0-indexed).
        Returns:
        The byte at index i in this value.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IndexOutOfBoundsException - if i &lt; 0 or {i >= size()}.

      • getInt

        default int getInt(int i)
        Retrieve the 4 bytes starting at the provided index in this value as an integer.
        Parameters:
        i - The index from which to get the int, which must less than or equal to size() - 4.
        Returns:
        An integer whose value is the 4 bytes from this value starting at index i.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IndexOutOfBoundsException - if i &lt; 0 or i &gt; size() - 4.

      • isZero

        default boolean isZero()
        Whether this value has only zero bytes.
        Returns:
        true if all the bits of this value are zeros.

      • hasLeadingZero

        default boolean hasLeadingZero()
        Whether the bytes start with a zero bit value.
        Returns:
        true if the first bit equals zero

      • numberOfLeadingZeros

        default int numberOfLeadingZeros()
        Returns:
        The number of zero bits preceding the highest-order ("leftmost") one-bit, or size() * 8 if all bits are zero.

      • hasLeadingZeroByte

        default boolean hasLeadingZeroByte()
        Whether the bytes start with a zero byte value.
        Returns:
        true if the first byte equals zero

      • numberOfLeadingZeroBytes

        default int numberOfLeadingZeroBytes()
        Returns:
        The number of leading zero bytes of the value.

      • bitLength

        default int bitLength()
        Returns:
        The number of bits following and including the highest-order ("leftmost") one-bit, or zero if all bits are zero.

      • and

        default Bytes and(Bytes other)
        Return a bit-wise AND of these bytes and the supplied bytes. If this value and the supplied value are different lengths, then the shorter will be zero-padded to the left.
        Parameters:
        other - The bytes to perform the operation with.
        Returns:
        The result of a bit-wise AND.

      • and

        default <T extends MutableBytes> T and(Bytes other,
                                       T result)
        Calculate a bit-wise AND of these bytes and the supplied bytes.

        If this value or the supplied value are shorter in length than the output vector, then they will be zero-padded to the left. Likewise, if either this value or the supplied valid is longer in length than the output vector, then they will be truncated to the left.

        Type Parameters:
        T - The MutableBytes value type.
        Parameters:
        other - The bytes to perform the operation with.
        result - The mutable output vector for the result.
        Returns:
        The result output vector.

      • or

        default Bytes or(Bytes other)
        Return a bit-wise OR of these bytes and the supplied bytes.

        If this value and the supplied value are different lengths, then the shorter will be zero-padded to the left.

        Parameters:
        other - The bytes to perform the operation with.
        Returns:
        The result of a bit-wise OR.

        If this value or the supplied value are shorter in length than the output vector, then they will be zero-padded to the left. Likewise, if either this value or the supplied valid is longer in length than the output vector, then they will be truncated to the left.

        Type Parameters:
        T - The MutableBytes value type.
        Parameters:
        other - The bytes to perform the operation with.
        result - The mutable output vector for the result.
        Returns:
        The result output vector.

        Type Parameters:

      • shiftRight

        default Bytes shiftRight(int distance)
        Shift all bits in this value to the right.
        Parameters:
        distance - The number of bits to shift by.
        Returns:
        A value containing the shifted bits.

      • shiftRight

        default <T extends MutableBytes> T shiftRight(int distance,
                                              T result)
        Shift all bits in this value to the right.

        If this value is shorter in length than the output vector, then it will be zero-padded to the left. Likewise, if this value is longer in length than the output vector, then it will be truncated to the left (after shifting).

        Type Parameters:
        T - The MutableBytes value type.
        Parameters:
        distance - The number of bits to shift by.
        result - The mutable output vector for the result.
        Returns:
        The result output vector.

        Parameters:

        Returns:
        A value containing the shifted bits.

      • shiftLeft

        default <T extends MutableBytes> T shiftLeft(int distance,
                                             T result)
        Shift all bits in this value to the left.

        If this value is shorter in length than the output vector, then it will be zero-padded to the left. Likewise, if this value is longer in length than the output vector, then it will be truncated to the left.

        Type Parameters:
        T - The MutableBytes value type.
        Parameters:
        distance - The number of bits to shift by.
        result - The mutable output vector for the result.
        Returns:
        The result output vector.

      • slice

        default Bytes slice(int i)
        Create a new value representing (a view of) a slice of the bytes of this value.

        Please note that the resulting slice is only a view and as such maintains a link to the underlying full value. So holding a reference to the returned slice may hold more memory than the slide represents. Use copy() on the returned slice if that is not what you want.

        Parameters:
        i - The start index for the slice.
        Returns:
        A new value providing a view over the bytes from index i (included) to the end.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IndexOutOfBoundsException - if i &lt; 0.

      • slice

        Bytes slice(int i,
            int length)
        Create a new value representing (a view of) a slice of the bytes of this value.

        Please note that the resulting slice is only a view and as such maintains a link to the underlying full value. So holding a reference to the returned slice may hold more memory than the slide represents. Use copy() on the returned slice if that is not what you want.

        Parameters:
        i - The start index for the slice.
        length - The length of the resulting value.
        Returns:
        A new value providing a view over the bytes from index i (included) to i + length (excluded).
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if length &lt; 0.
        java.lang.IndexOutOfBoundsException - if i &lt; 0 or {i >= size()} or {i + length > size()} .

      • copy

        Bytes copy()
        Return a value equivalent to this one but guaranteed to 1) be deeply immutable (i.e. the underlying value will be immutable) and 2) to not retain more bytes than exposed by the value.
        Returns:
        A value, equals to this one, but deeply immutable and that doesn't retain any "unreachable" bytes. For performance reasons, this is allowed to return this value however if it already fit those constraints.

      • mutableCopy

        MutableBytes mutableCopy()
        Return a new mutable value initialized with the content of this value.
        Returns:
        A mutable copy of this value. This will copy bytes, modifying the returned value will not modify this value.

      • copyTo

        default void copyTo(MutableBytes destination)
        Copy the bytes of this value to the provided mutable one, which must have the same size.
        Parameters:
        destination - The mutable value to which to copy the bytes to, which must have the same size as this value. If you want to copy value where size differs, you should use slice(int) and/or MutableBytes.mutableSlice(int, int) and apply the copy to the result.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if this.size() != destination.size().

      • copyTo

        default void copyTo(MutableBytes destination,
                    int destinationOffset)
        Copy the bytes of this value to the provided mutable one from a particular offset.

        This is a (potentially slightly more efficient) shortcut for copyTo(destination.mutableSlice(destinationOffset, this.size())).

        Parameters:
        destination - The mutable value to which to copy the bytes to, which must have enough bytes from destinationOffset for the copied value.
        destinationOffset - The offset in destination at which the copy starts.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the destination doesn't have enough room, that is if this.size() &gt; (destination.size() - destinationOffset).

      • appendTo

        default void appendTo(io.vertx.core.buffer.Buffer buffer)
        Append the bytes of this value to the provided Vert.x Buffer.

        Note that since a Vert.x Buffer will grow as necessary, this method never fails.

        Parameters:
        buffer - The Buffer to which to append this value.

      • appendHexTo

        default <T extends java.lang.Appendable> T appendHexTo(T appendable)
                                                throws java.io.IOException
        Append this value as a sequence of hexadecimal characters.
        Type Parameters:
        T - The appendable type.
        Parameters:
        appendable - The appendable
        Returns:
        The appendable.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - If an IO error occurs.

      • commonPrefixLength

        default int commonPrefixLength(Bytes other)
        Return the number of bytes in common between this set of bytes and another.
        Parameters:
        other - The bytes to compare to.
        Returns:
        The number of common bytes.

      • commonPrefix

        default Bytes commonPrefix(Bytes other)
        Return a slice over the common prefix between this set of bytes and another.
        Parameters:
        other - The bytes to compare to.
        Returns:
        A slice covering the common prefix.

      • trimLeadingZeros

        default Bytes trimLeadingZeros()
        Return a slice of representing the same value but without any leading zero bytes.
        Returns:
        value if its left-most byte is non zero, or a slice that exclude any leading zero bytes.

      • update

        default void update(java.security.MessageDigest digest)
        Update the provided message digest with the bytes of this value.
        Parameters:
        digest - The digest to update.

      • toArray

        default byte[] toArray()
        Extract the bytes of this value into a byte array.
        Returns:
        A byte array with the same content than this value.

      • toArrayUnsafe

        default byte[] toArrayUnsafe()
        Get the bytes represented by this value as byte array.

        Contrarily to toArray(), this may avoid allocating a new array and directly return the backing array of this value if said value is array backed and doing so is possible. As such, modifications to the returned array may or may not impact this value. As such, this method should be used with care and hence the "unsafe" moniker.

        Returns:
        A byte array with the same content than this value, which may or may not be the direct backing of this value.

      • toString

        java.lang.String toString()
        Return the hexadecimal string representation of this value.
        Overrides:
        toString in class java.lang.Object
        Returns:
        The hexadecimal representation of this value, starting with "0x".

      • toHexString

        default java.lang.String toHexString()
        Returns:
        This value represented as hexadecimal, starting with "0x".

      • toShortHexString

        default java.lang.String toShortHexString()
        Returns:
        This value represented as a minimal hexadecimal string (without any leading zero).
